The Indian Congress party has formally requested the government to construct a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh. The government has expressed its commitment to delivering this request.

  • Manmohan Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014.
  • The memorial is seen as a tribute to his contributions to India's development.

“Manmohan Singh’s leadership during critical times has shaped modern India.”

This initiative signifies respect for Manmohan Singh’s legacy and aims to preserve his contributions for future generations.

4th Test, Day 2: Steve Smith Century, Yashasvi Jaiswal Run Out Deflate India At MCG - News18
summary:
4th Test, Day 2: Steve Smith Century, Yashasvi Jaiswal Run Out Deflate India At MCG

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: News18

India faced a challenging second day in the fourth Test against Australia, with significant contributions from Steve Smith and unfortunate dismissals for Jaiswal and Kohli.

  • Yashasvi Jaiswal was run out after a mix-up with Virat Kohli, impacting India's momentum.
  • India reached 164/5, trailing by 310 runs after Australia scored 474.
  • Steve Smith scored his 34th Test century, with a total of 112 runs on the day.
  • Jaiswal scored 82 runs before falling victim to a critical run-out.
  • India struggled with their bowling strategy, allowing Australia to dominate.
“This moment will be one for posterity as Kohli looked down and perhaps felt that he could have at least said a loud 'No' to allow Jaiswal to sprint back.”

India will need a strong performance on Day 3 to overcome the pressure of follow-on.
newTitle: Steve Smith's Century and Jaiswal's Run Out: A Tough Day for India at MCG

title: Rapper OG Maco dies at 32 two weeks after suffering a self-inflicted gunshot wound - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rapper OG Maco dies at 32 after self-inflicted gunshot wound, surrounded by family in hospital.

Date: Dec 28, 2024 12:42 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Rapper OG Maco has died at the age of 32, two weeks after a self-inflicted gunshot wound. He was surrounded by family at a Los Angeles hospital when he passed away, according to reports.

  • OG Maco was known for his song “U Guessed It.”
  • His family shared a heartfelt statement on X, reflecting on his life and impact.
  • Maco had been admitted to the hospital on December 12 due to the gunshot wound.
  • He was found unresponsive at his home after a gunshot was reported by a neighbor.
  • The rapper was in a coma and his condition deteriorated over the following days.
“Through his music, passion, and unwavering spirit, he touched so many lives and left a lasting impact.” – Family Statement

The loss of OG Maco is felt deeply by fans and loved ones alike, as they remember his extraordinary life and the influence he had on many.
newTitle: Rapper OG Maco dies at 32 two weeks after suffering a self-inflicted gunshot wound

summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes History With Closest Pass to Sun

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NASA Science

The Parker Solar Probe has accomplished a historic milestone by making the closest-ever approach to the Sun.

  • The Parker Solar Probe traveled within a remarkable distance of the Sun's surface.
  • This mission aims to gather data on solar winds and the Sun's atmosphere.
  • The probe's findings could enhance understanding of solar behavior and its impact on Earth.
“This mission represents a groundbreaking achievement in solar exploration,” said a NASA spokesperson.

This event marks a significant step in space exploration, providing insights that could shape future solar research.

Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study - The Times of India
summary:
Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: NEJM Evidence

A recent study indicates that blood transfusions are life-saving for anemic individuals after a heart attack, showing a reduced risk of death within six months for those receiving more transfusions.

  • Anemia affects about one-third of congestive heart failure cases and raises heart attack risk.
  • Patients with fewer transfusions had a 9.3% death rate within 30 days compared to 8.1% for those receiving more transfusions.
  • Heart-related deaths were 5.5% for fewer transfusions vs. 3.7% for those with more transfusions.
  • Over 4,300 patients' data from four trials were analyzed for the study.
“The results of this analysis show that giving more blood to anemic patients with heart attacks can save lives at six months.” - Dr. Jeffrey Carson

While blood transfusions can significantly benefit anemic heart attack patients, caution is advised due to potential risks such as infection or fluid buildup.
newTitle: Study Shows Blood Transfusions Benefit Anemic Heart Attack Patients

title: 'Shocking & deliberate insult': Congress, SAD slam Centre over Manmohan Singh's last rites, memorial - The Times of India
summary:
Shocking & deliberate insult: Congress, SAD slam Centre over Manmohan Singh's last rites, memorial

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Congress party and the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) have expressed outrage over the arrangements made by the central government for the last rites and memorial of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, describing them as a deliberate insult.

  • The Congress and SAD leaders were critical of the government's handling of the situation.
  • They highlighted the perceived disrespect shown during the last rites and memorial services.
  • The outcry reflects broader tensions between the central government and opposition parties.
“It is shocking and a deliberate insult to the legacy of Manmohan Singh.” - Congress Leader

This incident has sparked significant political discussions regarding the treatment of former leaders and the role of the central government in memorializing their contributions.
newTitle: Congress and SAD Criticize Centre Over Manmohan Singh's Last Rites

title: NASA's Parker Solar Probe ‘safe’ after record-breaking brush with scorching surface, ‘phones home’ after several days | Mint - Mint
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe ‘safe’ after record-breaking brush with scorching surface, ‘phones home’ after several days

Publication Date: Recent Update | Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe has successfully survived its closest approach to the Sun, reaching within 6 million kilometers of the star’s surface. NASA confirmed that the spacecraft is safe and continues to operate normally after its historic flyby.

  • The Parker Solar Probe flew within 3.8 million miles (approximately 6 million kilometers) of the solar surface, marking the closest approach ever made by a human-made object.
  • The probe reported back to NASA on December 26, confirming its health and operational status after a brief period of silence during the flyby.
  • Launched in 2018, the Parker Solar Probe aims to study the Sun’s corona and the solar wind, contributing to our understanding of solar dynamics.
  • The spacecraft is equipped with a heat shield capable of withstanding temperatures up to 1370°C.
  • Scientists are hopeful that data collected during this mission will illuminate longstanding questions regarding the Sun's atmospheric temperatures and dynamics.
“Parker Solar Probe has phoned home! After passing just 3.8 million miles from the solar surface... we have received Parker Solar Probe’s beacon tone confirming the spacecraft is safe,” NASA stated.

The successful operations and data collection from the Parker Solar Probe contribute valuable insights into solar physics, aiming to unravel mysteries about the Sun that affect space weather and, by extension, life on Earth.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Successfully Completes Record-Breaking Approach to the Sun

7 Mesmerising Images Of Star Clusters Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
7 Mesmerising Images Of Star Clusters Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases stunning images of various star clusters captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique features and significance in the universe.

  • NGC 3603: A vibrant star-forming region with a dense star cluster at its center.
  • R136: Home to some of the most massive stars discovered in the universe.
  • NGC 6397: One of the nearest globular clusters to Earth at approximately 7,800 light-years away.
  • 30 Doradus: The largest and most active star-forming region in our galaxy.
  • Artist’s Concept of the Arches Cluster: Known for its dense collection of young stars located near the Milky Way’s center.
  • NGC 346: Part of the most energetic star-forming region in the Small Magellanic Cloud.
  • N11: An area in the Large Magellanic Cloud known for its active star formation.
“These stunning images reveal the beauty and complexity of star formation in our universe.”

The featured images not only captivate the viewer but also provide deep insights into the processes occurring in the cosmos, illustrating the pivotal role of the Hubble Space Telescope in astronomical research.
newTitle: 7 Mesmerising Images Of Star Clusters Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM

Published on: December 27, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of Home Affairs has ordered a State funeral for former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh at Nigambodh Ghat, which has sparked controversy with the Congress party calling it a deliberate insult to Singh's legacy.

  • Dr Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92.
  • The Congress demanded a funeral location suitable for a memorial.
  • The decision for Nigambodh Ghat was made after discussions between Congress leaders and government officials.
  • Senior Congress leaders expressed that the choice of location is viewed as disrespectful.
  • Dr Singh was a highly revered figure, recognized for his significant contributions to India.
“This is nothing but a deliberate insult to the first Sikh Prime Minister of India, Dr. Manmohan Singh,” said Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh.

The government's decision has sparked a broader discussion about how national leaders are honored in death and the significance of memorials for their contributions.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh's Funeral Sparks Controversy Over Location Choice

title: Baby John box office collection day 3: Varun Dhawan film fails to sustain opening day momentum - Hindustan Times
summary:
Baby John box office collection day 3: Varun Dhawan film fails to sustain opening day momentum

Date: Dec 27, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Varun Dhawan's latest outing, Baby John, initially had a promising box office performance but has seen a significant decline in collections over the first three days.

  • Baby John opened on Christmas with a strong day one collection of ₹11.25 crore.
  • By day three, collections dropped to ₹3.65 crore, totaling ₹19.65 crore (nett).
  • The film suffered a 57.78% decline in collections from day one to day two.
  • Despite being Varun's biggest opening in five years, the film is struggling against competition from other releases.
“Overall, there’s nothing much that makes Baby John stand out apart from the action.”

The film's decline in box office performance highlights the challenges faced by new releases in a competitive market.
newTitle: Baby John box office collection day 3: Varun Dhawan film fails to sustain opening day momentum

title: DGCA suspends two top officials at Akasa Air over “training lapses” - The Hindu
summary:
DGCA Suspends Two Akasa Air Officials Over Training Lapses

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has suspended the head of operations and head of training at Akasa Air for six months due to training lapses related to the use of an uncertified simulator for pilot training.

  • DGCA conducted a regulatory audit that revealed significant training violations.
  • Capt. Floyd Gracious and Neeraj Bhatia are suspended and must be replaced by suitable candidates.
  • Previous fines and penalties for Akasa Air indicate ongoing compliance issues.
The DGCA noted that the airline's response to earlier violations was unsatisfactory.

This suspension highlights the ongoing scrutiny faced by Akasa Air concerning pilot training and operational compliance.
newTitle: DGCA Suspends Two Akasa Air Officials Over Training Lapses

title: Pakistan lose their way after Bosch bash hands South Africa advantage - ESPNcricinfo
First Time In 147 Years: South Africa Debutant Corbin Bosch Scripts History, Achieves Unique Feat - NDTV Sports
summary:
First Time In 147 Years: South Africa Debutant Corbin Bosch Scripts History, Achieves Unique Feat

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Corbin Bosch, a South African cricket all-rounder, made headlines with a remarkable performance on his Test debut against Pakistan at Centurion. He achieved a rare milestone by securing a four-wicket haul and scoring 81 runs while batting at No. 9.

  • First cricketer to score a half-century and take four wickets on Test debut.
  • Broken 122-year-old record for highest score by a South African debutant at No. 8 or lower.
  • First instance in Test cricket history of a batter scoring 80+ runs on debut at No. 9.
  • Bosch's score of 81* is now the highest score for a No. 9 on Test debut.
“Bosch hit 15 fours in a 93-ball innings to follow up his first-innings bowling figures of four for 63.”

This historic achievement underscores Bosch's potential and sets a new standard for future cricketers in South Africa.
newTitle: Corbin Bosch Makes History on Test Debut for South Africa

title: 'Virat Kohli would have...': Sunil Gavaskar reacts to Yashasvi Jaiswal run out, claims 'but the thing was...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Analyzes Yashasvi Jaiswal's Run Out Incident

Date: Dec 27, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses a critical moment in the Boxing Day Test match where Virat Kohli and Yashasvi Jaiswal experienced a run-out mishap. Former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar shared his insights on the incident.

  • A mix-up between Kohli and Jaiswal led to Jaiswal's run-out during a match against Australia.
  • Gavaskar noted that although it was a risky single, Kohli had the potential to make it if he had followed Jaiswal's call.
  • Jaiswal scored 82 runs and Kohli contributed 36 runs before falling victim to errors in judgment.
  • Former Aussie captain Justin Langer commented on the risk associated with running against Pat Cummins.
“It would have been a quick run, and somebody like Virat Kohli would definitely have made it...” - Sunil Gavaskar

The incident highlights the importance of communication and decision-making in cricket, especially under pressure.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Analyzes Yashasvi Jaiswal's Run Out Incident

JSW Neo Energy to acquire O2 Power at enterprise value of $1.47 billion | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
JSW Neo Energy to Acquire O2 Power for $1.47 Billion

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

JSW Neo Energy, a subsidiary of JSW Energy Ltd, is set to acquire O2 Power at an enterprise value of $1.47 billion, subject to necessary approvals.

  • O2 Power has a capacity of 4.7 GW in renewable energy.
  • The ownership of O2 Power is currently held by EQT and Temasek, who will exit after the acquisition.
  • This acquisition will increase JSW Neo Energy's planned generation capacity by 23%.
  • JSW Energy aims to strengthen its position in the Indian energy sector with this deal.
  • CEO Parag Sharma expressed excitement about the new partnership and focus on renewable energy goals.
“This marks the beginning of the next phase for O2 Power... We look forward to working with JSW Neo Energy for the next phase.” - Parag Sharma, CEO of O2 Power

The acquisition signifies a strategic expansion for JSW Neo Energy in the renewable sector, aligning with India's energy goals.
newTitle: JSW Neo Energy to Acquire O2 Power for $1.47 Billion

title: Driver who killed 35 in China car ramming sentenced to death - DAWN.com
summary:
Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35

Publication Date: Today, Source: State Media

A man who deliberately drove through a crowd of people exercising outside a sports complex in Zhuhai, China, killing 35, has been sentenced to death. The 62-year-old, Fan Weiqiu, was found guilty of venting his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations. The attack, which occurred on November 11, was the deadliest in China since 2014.

  1. The defendant was tried and sentenced on the same day, with the court citing the extreme nature of the crime and its severe consequences.
  2. Fan pleaded guilty in front of victims' families, officials, and members of the public.
  3. The attack has sparked anger and discussion online, with some calling for immediate execution.
Fan decided to vent his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations, leading to the deadly attack.

The sentencing comes amid a string of mass casualty incidents in China this year, challenging the country's reputation for good public security.
newTitle: Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35
